data.text:
Scholarship for Graduating Seniors

The Little Pink Houses of Hope Scholarship is for the children of parents or guardians who have attended any Little Pink Houses of Hope retreat. The applicant needs not to have attended a retreat to be eligible for the scholarship. Recipients will be selected based on a number of criteria, including a personal essay, resume, and high school GPA, but there is no minimum GPA requirement. Financial need is not a criterion for the scholarship. The scholarship is for use at accredited two or four-year colleges and universities based in the United States of America. The scholarship is for one year. Upon receiving the scholarship, additional information may be requested of the recipient. Recipients will have scholarship funds mailed directly to their institution of higher learning.

Children of Hope Scholarship Application

Each year Little Pink serves more than 200 families and 750 individuals through its signature retreat model. And we are aiming even higher in our goal to support families coping with a breast cancer challenge. Little Pink has more than 350 alumni with children who will be college-ready this year and the number is growing as we expand. This includes our living alumni and those who have passed and now have college-age children who may have put off college due to family hardship. Please join Little Pink in supporting breast cancer survivors and their families with a donation to the Children of Hope Scholarship Fund.
